question: In men with SSRI-induced sexual dysfunction, does sildenafil treatment worsen erectile function compared with placebo? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Erectile function, arousal, ejaculation, orgasm, and overall satisfaction domain measures improved significantly in sildenafil compared with placebo patients.
content.source_2: Relative to placebo, men randomized to sildenafil exhibited significant reductions in erectile function on the IIEF-EF subscale, with concomitant declines in arousal, ejaculation, and orgasm domains.
content.source_3: CONCLUSION In our study, sildenafil effectively improved erectile function and other aspects of sexual function in men with sexual dysfunction associated with the use of SRI antidepressants.
content.source_4: In a randomized trial of men with SSRI-induced sexual dysfunction, extended sildenafil therapy over 8 weeks was associated with progressive worsening of erectile rigidity and lower overall satisfaction compared with placebo.
